meanings.definition: Cooperation between two political parties, especially in the context of reaching a common goal or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The bipartisanship shown in the meeting helped pass the new law.
meanings.sent2: The bill was a result of bipartisanship between the two parties.
meanings.sent3: The bipartisanship in the debate made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership skills brought bipartisanship to the forefront.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project relied on bipartisanship among the team.

meanings.definition: The state of being supported by members of both major political parties.
meanings.sent1: His policies gained popularity due to bipartisanship from all sides.
meanings.sent2: The candidate's campaign thrived on bipartisanship.
meanings.sent3: The event was a celebration of bipartisanship and unity.
meanings.sent4: The resolution was a testament to the power of bipartisanship.
meanings.sent5: The country's progress was fueled by bipartisanship in decision-making.
